reasoning: The student has identified relevant environmental, ethical, and safety issues, although some are more pertinent than others.  For example, while mentioning the non-biodegradable nature of paraffin wax is valid, the immediate safety concern of an open flame is more critical to the execution of the lab. The discussion of heat loss to the surroundings as a systematic error is standard and appropriate for this type of experiment. Acknowledging incomplete combustion as another source of systematic error demonstrates a good understanding of the experimental limitations. The extension ideas are simple but relevant to the investigation. Overall, this section shows a solid grasp of experimental design and error analysis.
